Class RunBank

java.lang.Object
RunBank
public class RunBank
extends java.lang.Object
The RunBank class consists of static methods that operate on or return objects pertaining to another class. The Class functions as a user interface for the user to be able to input answers, this class then stores and manipulates the data to output Success or Error messages. RunBank also has the ability to read and write to a CSV file as well as write to a txt file to let user know what transactions they have performed and update the balances in a .csv file after the program is done running.
Since:
March 15,2021

    • messagesToWriteToCSV

      private static void messagesToWriteToCSV​(Customer currUser, Customer recipient, Account accountIn, Account accountOut, java.io.File fileIn, double amount, int choice) throws java.io.IOException
      Generates a message for the given choice,based off of which action the user wants to take, that is then written into the generated txt file
      Parameters:
      currUser - takes in the Customer object of the currentUser
      recipient - takes in the Customer object of the recipient
      accountIn - takes in the specific Account object that is being dealth with (Credit, Savings, Checkings)
      accountOut - takes in the specific Account object that is being dealt with (Credit, Savings, Checkings)
      fileIn - takes in the file to be written to
      amount - the amount the user is working with for choices (2 - 5)
      choice - determines which message will be generated based off of what action user takes.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - finds if the input file stream, that is being written to is not corrupt

    • chooseAccount

      private static int chooseAccount​(int chosenAction)
      Helper method allows user to choose which account or accounts they want to use.
      Parameters:
      chosenAction - indicating choice based off of which action user wants to take
      Returns:
      userAccountType: user choice of account
